title: Animal Magnetism

items: Mithril axe (required to obtain the blessed axe; no other type of axe will do)
Ghostspeak amulet (Morytania legs will not work)
20 ecto-tokens (or 4 bones, 4 buckets, and 4 pots to gain the tokens)

rewards: Ava's attractor if your Ranged level is less than 50, or Ava's accumulator if your Ranged level is 50 or higher

other: The ability to defeat a level 64 (using any combat style) and two level 30 enemies using either Ranged or Magic.

items: Needle or costume needle (one needle spawns in Pellem's Fur Store nearby)

title: Beneath Cursed Sands
rewards: A Keris partisan. (If your inventory was full, you may claim one for free from Selim in front of Al Kharid Palace.)
The circlet of water, an untradeable helm that acts like a waterskin when worn. (If your inventory was full, you may claim one for free from the High Priest in Sophanem.)
Jaltevas teleport option on the Pharaoh's sceptre. (Unlocked by selecting Commune on an obelisk in the necropolis, by the mine.)

title: Between a Rock...

other: The ability to defeat a level 75-125 enemy ''(depends on how much gold you mine)''

items: 4 gold bars (You will need an extra bar and telegrab if you want to keep a golden cannonball for after the quest)

rewards: You get to keep your gold helmet and can continue using it to fire yourself into the rock to access the Arzinian Mine where there are lots of gold rocks and gold veins, and a nearby dwarf, at the river, banks the player's gold ore for a charge (he keeps 20% of the ores, rounded up, or 10% of the ores if the player has the ring of charos (a)).

other: The ability to defend against level 64 wolves and level 53 ogres

items: Any axe that you can use (Blessed axe does not work)
Feathers (100 to be safe; coloured feathers from work) Bringing to buy 25 feathers from Fycie also works
Knife (or to buy a knife and chisel from Bugs)
Chisel (or to buy a knife and chisel from Bugs)
Priest gown top and Priest gown bottom
Gas mask (can be obtained for free from the cupboard in Edmond and Alrena's house in East Ardougne)

other: The ability to evade level 33 Black Knights

items: Cabbage (can be obtained from the cabbage patch in Edgeville Monastery and South Falador Farm, as well as Lumbridge Castle#Cellar

title: Cabin Fever
rewards: 10,000 coins (only if you speak to Bill Teach after the quest)

title: Cold War

other: Access to a crafting table 3

items: Clockwork ''or'' a steel bar to make one
Raw cod ''or'' the ring of charos (a)

rewards: Players can also steal more cowbells and make more bongos. The cowbells or the bongos can only be played in a penguin suit.

items: A tinderbox (unless you have a non extinguishable light source such as Kandarin headgear, Firemaking cape, Abyssal lantern, or a bruma torch). If you don't have one, the Sophanem guard will sell you one for 50 coins.

title: Cook's Assistant
rewards: Permission to use the Cook-o-matic 100, which reduces the chance of burning some foods.

other: Able to defeat a level 51 monster and run past level 72 monsters

title: Darkness of Hallowvale

other: The ability to withstand several melee attacks from a level 169 enemy.

rewards: Tome of , granting 2,000 to any three skills of the player's choosing (level 30 or over). Can be the same skill.

title: Death on the Isle
rewards: A costume needle from the costumer
The butler's tray and an assortment of masks from the Head Butler

items: 60 coins (bring 1000 for the gambling dice with Harold part)
Asgarnian ale (can be found on the bar at the pub in Burthorpe)

title: Death to the Dorgeshuun

other: The ability to defeat a level 50 enemy with Melee or Magic

items: Any light source (lanterns are recommended - open light sources such as a candle can cause gas explosions and require a tinderbox)
Pickaxe (if not using a games necklace to teleport to Tears of Guthix (minigame)

rewards: A torch if you did not have a light source in your inventory at the end of the quest

items: Barronite deposit or a pickaxe to mine one

title: Demon Slayer

items: 25 bones (can't be noted, but can be delivered in increments)

rewards: Silverlight (if lost, players may retrieve it from Sir Prysin for a fee of 500 coins.)

other: Ability to kill a level 36 Sand Snake

title: Desert Treasure I

other: Access to Morytania Graveyard

items: Bones (can be noted to prevent accidental burial)
Garlic powder (made by grinding garlic in a pestle and mortar)
Spice (gnome spice and Evil Dave's spices will '''not''' work)
A sweet (cake, chocolate cake (part cakes are accepted), or chocolate bar)
Climbing boots (if Eadgar's Ruse isn't completed and/or you lack 61 Magic for the Trollheim Teleport)
A facemask, slayer helmet, or gas mask

rewards: Ring of visibility: If you ever lose it, you can obtain another one from Rasolo.

title: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire

quests: curse of the empty lord, for full ghostly robes

kills: A number of lesser demons, black demons, and abyssal creatures

title: The Dig Site

items: Cup of tea (can be stolen from the Varrock Ye Olde Tea Shoppe
2 ropes (can be stolen from a Digsite workman, but with average luck, this can easily take more than 15 minutes.)
Opal or uncut opal (small chance to acquire while panning for a quest item)

rewards: Show the museum curator the Level 3 certificate to choose between something to drink (Fruit blast) or something to eat (chocolate cake). Get the cake for Desert Treasure I / A Tail of Two Cats or the fruit blast for Recipe for Disaster. Make sure that you go through the dialogue for each one that you give it or he will not give you a chance to pick which reward you want and you will receive nothing.
The Ancient talisman can be viewed in the Digsite Exhibit at the museum on the

title: Doric's Quest
rewards: Bronze pickaxe given at the start of the quest

other: The ability to defeat a level 83 Elvarg|dragon

items: Unfired bowl (can be made with soft clay on a Potter's Wheel with Crafting)
Wizard's mind bomb (can be bought in the Rising Sun Inn in Falador or The Toad and Chicken in Burthorpe)
Lobster pot (can be bought from any Fishing shops
Silk (can be bought from Thessalia for 30 coins or the Al Kharid silk stall for 3 coins -- members can steal it from the Ardougne silk stall with Thieving)
90 steel nails (Members can buy these from the Sawmill operator north-east of Varrock, they can also be smithed at Smithing using 6 steel bars by all players)

3 planks (only normal planks) Free-to-play: Pick up the spawns in the Graveyard of Shadows, level 19 Wilderness, or for a safer option, ornate lockboxes in the Camdozaal Vault after Below Ice Mountain Member: Plank#Spawns

other: Started the Barbarian_Training#Pyre_ships|pyre ship portion of the Barbarian Training miniquest to gain access to the Ancient Cavern

items: 12 nails of any kind ('''Note:''' Bringing more is recommended; nails may bend!)
Seal of passage (or elite Fremennik Diary completion)
Runes for 3 Fire Wave spells '''or''' 3 Fire Surge spells

title: Dream Mentor

other: The ability to defeat 4 powerful monsters without the use of prayer

rewards: 7 new spells added to your Lunar spells book (Monster Examine, Humidify, Hunter Kit, Stat Spy, Dream, Plank Make, Spellbook Swap)
'Birds-Eye' Jack will now allow you to use the bank without a seal of passage equipped or in your inventory.

items: Climbing boots (or 12 coins to buy from Tenzing)
Pineapple chunks (pineapples are sold by Funch's Fine Groceries
5 Raw chicken (there are chickens on the way at Tenzing's house. Undead chickens do not work)

title: Eagles' Peak
rewards: Captured ferrets can be used to flush rabbits from their holes, allowing them to be caught in rabbit snares

items: 4 coal (4 more for each additional bar you would like to produce)

title: Elemental Workshop II

items: The battered key from Elemental Workshop I

rewards: To make a mind shield: have the slashed book from the Elemental Workshop I quest in your inventory, then smith a primed mind bar into a mind shield

title: Enakhra's Lament

other: Must be on the standard spellbook

items: bread, any kind of pie, any kind of cake, any kind of pizza, or a baked potato with topping (partial pies, cakes and pizzas do '''not''' work, and neither will burnt versions)
Pickaxe (unless you already have the required items)

rewards: Camulet, which allows you to talk to camels and teleport to the temple four times. It can be recharged by using camel dung on it. You can pay Lazim 1 million gold pieces to give it unlimited charges.
Camel mask (Use a piece of soft clay on the pedestal with the globes on it to make.)

title: Enlightened Journey

items: 8 empty sacks – bring 9 sacks if planning to fill one with potatoes on Entrana.

12 unnoted willow branches (buy from the Grand Exchange, or plant a willow sapling and wait 4 hours.) Note: A willow seed is not required, nor is a basket of apples as payment (although planting one beforehand is faster); all players receive a Auguste's sapling

rewards: Gnome goggles from the Gnome Restaurant minigame can be combined with the bomber cap by talking with Auguste

other: The ability to defend from a level 22 Skeleton.

title: The Eyes of Glouphrie

items: Bucket of sap (If you do not have one, you can use a knife on any Tree#Single canopy

rewards: A crystal saw seed — Either take it to Ilfeen in Tirannwn or use it on the singing bowl by Brimstail to get an enchanted crystal saw. It allows items (that require a saw) to be made three levels above your Construction. It has a limited number of charges (28), but the recharge is free - use the bowl again.

title: Fairytale I - Growing Pains

other: The ability to defeat a level 111 Tanglefoot with limited weaponry

items: A combination of three items picked for you at random, see Fairytale I - Growing Pains#Blessed secateurs

rewards: Magic secateurs (increases some crop harvests when Farming)

title: Family Crest

other: The ability to defeat a level 170 Demons|demon (can be safespotted)

items: Any poison cure like Antipoison (you will lose this item)

rewards: The steel gauntlets offer useful perks. Each brother will imbue them with a special ability. They will initially do this for free. Be careful choosing, though, since you can only have one effect, and it will cost you 25,000 coins to change them. Dimintheis will provide you with a "magically" found pair should you lose them.

title: The Feud

other: The ability to kill a level 70 Bandit champion|bandit and a level 75 Tough Guy|Menaphite (both can be safespotted).

items: Kharidian headpiece (can be bought from Ali Morrisane)
Fake beard (can be bought from Ali Morrisane)
if you have the snake charm in your bank already you will need to retrieve it

rewards: A desert disguise (created during the quest)
A willow blackjack (as a drop from the tough guy)
An adamant scimitar (as a drop from the bandit champion)

other: The ability to defeat level 44, 63 and 137 enemies (all can be safespotted)

items: 5 coins (10 if you buy a fishing rod from Jack)
2 barley malt (no range in Keldagrim, plain barley has to be cooked elsewhere)
Seed dibber (no Tool leprechaun in Keldagrim) or partial completion of the Farming portion of the Barbarian Training miniquest
A random item from the list below (see list for details)
Fishing rod or fly fishing rod

Fremennik shield (this is '''not''' the tradeable Neitiznot shield) Alternatively, get it from Bardur AFTER being exiled, for either '''or''' for free using a Ring of charos (a) Recommended: Rune thrownaxes or to get to Bardur in the Waterbirth Island Dungeon
Seal of Passage (if the Fremennik diaries

title: The Fremennik Isles

other: The ability to kill a level 122 Ice Troll King|Troll King (Damage can be reduced) and, separately, 10 rock throwing ice trolls in a multicombat area.

items: 8 tin ores, 7 pieces of coal, or 6 mithril ores (depends on your Mining level; level 1 will require tin ore, 2-54 will require coal, and 55-99 require mithril ore). '''Note:''' The ores can be noted.
a Neitiznot shield (or 56 Woodcutting, a hammer and a bronze nail)

rewards: Two lots of 10,000 Combat (choose between Strength, Attack, Defence or Hitpoints).

helm of Neitiznot, which is the equivalent of a berserker helm with a +3 Prayer bonus, slightly better Magic and crush Defence, and no negative bonuses. If a player loses the helm, they can talk to Mawnis Burowgar to buy another one for 50,000 coins.
Around 20,000 coins in assorted rewards during quest.
The banks in Neitiznot and Jatizso are close to water, range, furnace, fishing spots, mining ores; a spinning wheel is also nearby.
If the jester outfit is lost, a player can retrieve another one from the chest behind King Gjuki Sorvott IV's throne.
The Contraband Yak Produce shop is available on Jatizso if a player refunds the 5,000 coin tax to Vanligga Gastfrihet, who is north of the king.

title: The Fremennik Trials

other: If crafting the lyre:
* Players can kill Lanzig, Borrokar, Lensa, or Freidir to obtain the lyre ''(1/17 chance)''
Ability to defeat a level-69 Draugen
Ability to defeat a Koschei|fairly strong warrior without armour, weapons, or spells

items: a raw shark, raw manta ray, or raw sea turtle

rewards: Jarvald will charge no fee for travelling to Waterbirth Island

title: Garden of Tranquillity

items: All tool leprechaun tools A rake A seed dibber (or partial completion of the Farming portion of the Barbarian Training miniquest) A spade Secateurs (magic secateurs work) A watering can A gardening trowel
A marigold seed (2 recommended in case of failure)
3+ cabbage seeds (6 recommended to plant in both allotments to increase chance of survival)
3+ onion seeds (6 recommended to plant in both allotments to increase chance of survival)
2 ultracompost/supercompost/compost (note: Bottomless compost bucket will not work for these two required composts. The quality of these 2 composts do not matter.)

rewards: An activated ring of charos - players can wear the activated ring to charm various NPCs to pay less for certain services, or get choices that are otherwise unavailable.
4-dose compost potion, which can be used to turn compost into supercompost.
After the quest, the player can visit the garden and pick 4 fruits from the white tree. They regrow after some time, similar to other fruit bearing trees. Each fruit restores about 8% of energy.

title: Gertrude's Cat

items: Seasoned sardine (Bought from the Grand Exchange) or alternatively: Raw sardine (Caught or bought from Gerrant's Fishy Business.) Doogle leaves (South of Gertrude's house)

rewards: Gertrude will now sell kittens for you to raise for coins each.

title: Getting Ahead

items: Bear fur, grey wolf fur, or Fur (a Grizzly bear and bear cub spawn west of the farm and two black bears spawn east of the farm)
6 nails of any kind (iron nails can be found in the workbench north of the house, and more than 6 is recommended in case you bend a few)

rewards: 3,000 coins — If not claimed at quest completion due to no available inventory space, talk to Gordon again after the quest for the reward.

title: Ghosts Ahoy

items: Ecto-tokens: 31 Ecto-tokens (20 with ring of charos (a)) OR 25 Ecto-tokens (10 with ring) using charter ships OR 1 bone, 1 pot, and 1 bucket for every 5 ecto-tokens required (see Ghosts_Ahoy#Pre-quest: obtaining ecto-tokens
3 colours of dye (The dye colours you will need are random. If you want to save a trip, have 3 Red dye

rewards: The Ectophial, which allows direct teleport to the Ectofuntus, is refilled from the Ectofuntus.

items: Logs (most logs will work, however, arctic pine, redwood & coloured logs do not work)
1 Blue dye (or 2 woad leaves and 5 coins to obtain a blue dye from Aggie) Offer 20 coins to Wyson the gardener and he will give you two woad leaves

1 Orange dye – created by combining red dye with yellow dye 1 Red dye (or 3 redberries and 5 coins to obtain a red dye from Aggie) 1 Yellow dye (2 onions and 5 coins to obtain a yellow dye from Aggie)

title: The Golem

items: Papyrus (can be bought from Ali Morrisane for 10gp)
4 soft clay (or a bracelet of clay and a pickaxe to mine north-west of the ruins)
Phoenix feather (can be obtained north-west of the ruins)
Means to enter the desert (such as the Shantay pass (item)

rewards: 2 cut rubies, emeralds, and sapphires (collect these by using a chisel and hammer on the throne)
Unlock the carpet ride from Shantay Pass to Uzer

other: The ability to defeat a level 172 Black demon (The Grand Tree)|Black demon (safespottable for Ranged and Magic or melee using a halberd).

items: 1,000 coins, unless you have helped Femi or completed Tree Gnome Village and plan to use spirit trees.

title: The Great Brain Robbery

other: Access to a player-owned house workshop and crafting table '''or''' the Grand Exchange
Be able to kill a level 190 monster that can disable Prayers (can be safespotted without taking damage).

items: Diving apparatus ''(obtain these from Murphy in Port Khazard if you've lost them; talk to him 2 times, 1st time for helmet and 2nd time for apparatus.)''

10 wooden cats – partial completion of The Great Brain Robbery is required to make these yourself, however they are tradeable and available at the Grand Exchange 4 oak planks, a hammer, and a saw (if you are building your own crafting table 1
A hammer (Note: Imcando hammer does not work)
100 nails ''(38 are needed, but some—especially Bronze nails
8 normal planks (18 if making the wooden cats instead of buying them from the Grand Exchange)

rewards: Barrelchest anchor (To repair your barrelchest anchor, return to Mos Le'Harmless and make sure you have a book o' piracy in your inventory; then, go to the docks south of the bank and talk to "Smith." He can fix your anchor for 230,000 coins.)

title: Grim Tales

other: Ability to defeat a level 138 cloud giant—Glod

items: 2 Tarromin potion (unf) ''or'' 2 vials of water and 2 tarromins
Watering can with at least 1 dose (can also be stored with the leprechaun)

rewards: Dwarven helmet (equip this helmet in the Dwarven Mines to complete a Hard Falador task)

title: The Hand in the Sand

items: 5 earth runes (can be bought from Betty for 20 gp)

rewards: A secret reward from Bert - He simply loves sand, and wasn't in the job for the money. He will ship 84 buckets of sand to your bank if you talk to him after the quest. This can be done once per day (UTC). Asking Bert to take sand to your bank is also an Ardougne Medium task.

other: The ability to defeat a level 95 enemy
Access to Abandoned Mine

title: Hazeel Cult
rewards: 2000 coins (plus 5 from the fake ending if you sided with the Carnillean family)
Hazeel's mark (if you sided with Hazeel)
Carnillean armour (if you sided with Ceril and obtained an extra during the quest)

other: A partner

items: Harralander potion (unf) (or a harralander and a vial of water)

other: Must be able to defeat a level 120 Black Knight Titan (can be safespotted or flinched)

title: Horror from the Deep

items: Any sword or longsword that you are willing to lose (except rusty sword and prop sword)
Any arrow (except ogre arrows and training arrows)
2 regular planks (can be obtained from Barbarian Outpost)

rewards: A damaged book of your choice which, when complete, will become: a Holy book (Saradomin), an Unholy book (Zamorak), or a Book of balance (Guthix).
Further damaged books can be purchased from Jossik for 5,000 coins each, even if you have not filled your other book(s).

title: Icthlarin's Little Helper

other: The ability to defeat a level 91 monster.

items: Bag of salt (can be bought from any Slayer Master, other players, or the Grand Exchange) '''or''' an empty bucket to obtain a pile of salt in Sophanem
Bucket of sap (use a knife on an evergreen tree or a Tree#Single_canopy
Full waterskin to give away (can be bought for 30 coins at Shantay pass)
Means to enter the desert. (Such as the Shantay pass (item)

rewards: Unlock the carpet rides from Pollnivneach to Sophanem and Menaphos

title: Imp Catcher
rewards: After the quest players can obtain more amulets by speaking to Wizard Mizgog with a complete set of beads.

items: 10 raw mackerel or 10 Snail meats (depending on what is asked)

Optional to give to Ivan Strom ('''''Strongly'' recommended if you don't have a high combat level''' 85+): A steel med helm A steel chainbody Steel platelegs A silver sickle 15 cooked salmon, snails, Cooked slimy eel

title: In Search of the Myreque

other: The ability to defeat a level 97 foe (safespottable)

items: A Druid pouch containing at least 5 charges
:'''Note:''' The pouch takes 3 per fill (need 6 Mort myre fungus or 3 Mort myre pear or Mort myre stem to have enough charges).

rewards: Lore associated in-game Membership of The Myreque.

other: The ability to defend against level 53 Jogres and level 46 Harpie Bug Swarms.

items: Full black armour (Black full helm, Black platebody

An Iron chainbody (Both the Iron Chainbody and the Bronze med helm can be bought upstairs in the Warrior Guild Armoury. If you can't access the Warriors' Guild you can get an Iron Chainbody from Wayne's Chains in Southern Falador, Horvik's Armour Shop in central Varrock, or the Grand Exchange)

title: A Kingdom Divided

items: A dark essence block or a pickaxe and chisel (the latter is found at the mine) to obtain one

rewards: 24 new spells made available in the Arceuus spellbook (all combat spells with the exception of Ghostly Grasp and Inferior Demonbane, and all utility spells with the exception of Resurrect Crops and reanimation spells).

title: The Knight's Sword

other: The ability to run from combat level|level 57 ice warriors and level 53 ice giants could help.

items: Redberry pie (not half a redberry pie), (Members can purchase one from Romily Weaklax in the Cooks' Guild)
2 iron bars (4 if you want your own blurite sword) (one spawns west of the Graveyard of Shadows in the Wilderness)

rewards: A blurite sword (if you got Thurgo to make you an extra one)

items: Fishing rod (Oily fishing rod will not work)

title: Legends' Quest

other: The ability to defeat a level 187 demon

items: 2 gold bars (6 in case you fail or want more gold bowls)
Lockpick (2 in case you fail) (Strange old lockpick does not work)
Sapphire Emerald Ruby Diamond Opal Jade Red topaz

rewards: 30,000 each in four skills of your choice (limited to Attack, Defence, Strength, Hitpoints, Prayer, Magic, Woodcutting, Crafting, Smithing, Herblore, Agility, Thieving. It is possible to choose the same skill all four times)
Radimus Erkle will provide replacement dark daggers, which can be investigated via right-click to switch appearance between a dark or glowing dagger
You can now receive the Rune spear, Dragon spear, and Shield left half from the Gem drop table.

title: Lost City

other: Ability to kill a level 101 Tree spirit (Lost City)|Tree spirit with limited armour and weapons.

items: axe (you will need to bank the axe before accessing Entrana -- you cannot use a blessed axe)

rewards: A permanent portal to Puro-Puro in the wheat field east of the fairy ring in Zanaris.

title: The Lost Tribe

items: Light source ('''Note:''' Candles, torches, and oil lamps can cause swamp gas explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

rewards: A mining helmet from giving the brooch back to Mistag.

other: The ability to kill multiple level 111 monsters.
Access to each of the elemental runic altars (Air Altar|Air, Fire Altar|Fire, Water Altar|Water, Earth Altar|Earth)

items: A finished bullseye lantern ('''NOT bullseye lantern (unf)
All elemental talismans or their respective tiaras (Air talisman

title: Making Friends with My Arm

other: It is beneficial to have a higher Agility level.

items: Climbing boots (if not using Trollheim teleports)

rewards: A new disease-free herb patch in Weiss (requires building the fire of nourishment before use)

title: Making History

items: Ghostspeak amulet or Morytania legs 2 or higher

A way to enter Port Phasmatys Completion of Ghosts Ahoy ''or'' 2 ecto-token ''or'' 1 bone, 1 pot and 1 bucket to earn 5 ecto-tokens (you still only need two) ''or'' 5,200 gold for a Charter ship to Port Phasmatys (cheaper depending upon where you travel from and if you use ring of charos).

rewards: Enchanted key, allowing you to go on your own treasure digs until it disappears

title: Merlin's Crystal
rewards: Appointment with a title as a Honorary Knight of the Round Table.

title: Monk's Friend

items: Regular logs or a regular plank

rewards: Brother Omad will throw parties for you by speaking to him.

title: Monkey Madness I

other: The ability to defeat a level 195 Jungle Demon

rewards: Speaking to Daero after the quest gives the choice of either, 35,000 in Attack and Defence and 20,000 in Strength and Hitpoints '''OR''' 35,000 in Strength and Hitpoints and 20,000 in Attack and Defence. The skills you tell Daero you want to focus on will receive 35,000 each, and the others 20,000 each.

title: Monkey Madness II

quests: balloon flight route to gnome stronghold must be unlocked to start the quest.
recipe for disaster/freeing_king_awowogei|recipe for disaster (freeing king awowogei)

items: A pickaxe (if you choose the tanking route)
A ninja monkey greegree (small or medium)
A slash weapon (to slash webs if you choose the tanking route - Wilderness sword of any tier recommended for this due to 100% web slash ability).

rewards: 2x 50,000 rewards from Duke in your choice of Magic, Ranged, Attack, Defence, Strength or Hitpoints. Found on the hill east of main gate of Ape Atoll. (Walk up west hill, and climb the ladder to reach the east hill). You cannot be trained if you have not yet been trained by Daero after completing Monkey Madness I. This effectively prevents certain account builds from receiving the training.
A Royal seed pod, which provides unlimited teleports to the Grand Tree (up to level 30 Wilderness).
Various dragons will now drop dragon javelin heads.
A Monkey can be found in one of the crates at the Crash Site. It is purely cosmetic and can be equipped in the cape slot.
Bobawu will now track your laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course, with you being able to transform your monkey into other variants upon completing a number of laps.

other: The ability to defeat a level 70 The Kendal|monster (can be safespot|safespotted)
The ability to defeat a level 11 enemy with your combat stats set to 20 each.

items: Toad crunchies or Premade t'd crunch
Barrel of naphtha, or 5-9 coal to make one

title: Mourning's End Part II

items: A chisel (one can be found in the house south of the Mourner HQ)

rewards: A crystal trinket, which allows you to enter the Temple of Light again after the quest
Death talismans can be obtained via Guardians of the Rift
Death runes can now be crafted during Guardians of the Rift

title: My Arm's Big Adventure

quests: the medium diary is desired, it is recommended to get 100% prior to starting this quest
other: At least 60% favour in the Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup minigame before starting this quest - this will be subtracted from the total favour

items: Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any Tool Leprechaun and withdrawn from the Tool Leprechaun (Larry)
Climbing boots (can be bought from Tenzing for 12 coins)

rewards: 457 (315 total) additional Farming while My Arm harvests his crop.

title: Nature Spirit

items: Silver sickle - either purchase it from the Grand Exchange, or make it with a silver bar and sickle mould in a furnace at 18 Crafting. Ironmen can buy a silver bar from the Silver merchant in Ardougne.

rewards: 3 meat pies and 3 apple pies unless they were rotted by the ghasts

items: Ghostspeak amulet (Morytania legs 2 or better also work)
Any axe besides the blessed axe

title: Observatory Quest
rewards: Your item reward depends on what astrological sign you see when you look through the telescope. It is different for each person. Each one rewards an uncut sapphire as well as the following:
The Spirit of Scorpius will now give you a mould to make unholy symbols, and he will bless them for you too. He can be found in the graveyard north of the Observatory.
Talk to the Observatory assistant after the quest and he will reward you with a jug of wine as well as tell you his and the professor's real name.

title: Olaf's Quest

other: The ability to defeat a level 100 monster

rewards: A piece of parchment telling you of other shipwrecks with more treasure. (This extra treasure is currently not available in the game)

title: Perilous Moons
rewards: In addition, completing the quest counts as a normal defeat of the Moons of Peril, allowing the player to loot the Lunar Chest for further rewards.

items: 60 coins (only 30 are needed if using a Ring of charos
Rope (Purchasable in the East Ardougne general store, Port Khazard general store, Ned, or a spawn in Karamja general store.)

Chocolate dust *Chocolate bar *Knife or pestle and mortar Bucket of milk (Obtained by using a bucket on a dairy cow, one is north of Ardougne, or bought from Hudo or Heckel Funch.) Snape grass (Spawns west of the Crafting Guild or the peninsula north-east of Hosidius. It can be grown at 61 Farming. Can also be obtained from killing Tribesmen in Karamja.)
Picture of Elena (Inside Alrena and Edmond's house)

title: A Porcine of Interest
rewards: Existing slayer helmets will have reinforced goggles added to them
Spria will now be able to give you slayer tasks

title: Priest in Peril

items: 50 unnoted rune essence or pure essence (can be mined by talking to Aubury in Varrock, after completing Rune Mysteries. All 50 essence does not have to be of the same type.)
Bucket (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))

rewards: Wolfbane dagger, prevents the citizens of Canifis from transforming into werewolves when attacked

title: Prince Ali Rescue

items: Yellow dye or 2 onions and 5 coins

rewards: Free passage through the Lumbridge - Al Kharid toll gate from now on.

items: 8 logs of any type (or an axe to obtain them)
Light source (a lantern is highly preferred)

quests: horror from the deep or partial completion of the fremennik trials
other: The ability to kill several high-level monsters

items: 27 jugs of vinegar (bought from Fortunato for 27 coins)
27 sets of logs (any logs - normal logs can be obtained on the path just below the Odd Old Man's hut if you bring an axe).
Mirror shield or V's shield (unless using a workaround - see guide for how to get around using this)

other: Access to Keldagrim
*The Giant Dwarf started

items: Any type of cat or hellcat (for most of the quest, a cat with a high successful rat catch rate is recommended, and overgrown cats cannot be used there -- during the Ratcatchers#Hooknosed Jack
Catspeak amulet (unless Dragon Slayer II is completed)
Pot of weeds (use an empty pot with weeds)
101 coins (or 51 coins with a ring of charos (a))

quests: started legends' quest up until gaining access to the kharazi jungle
other: All prerequisite quest requirements
The ability to defeat high leveled monsters, several of which have to be defeated without using {{SCP|Prayer|link=yes}}

items: Any fruit blast excluding a premade fr' blast
320 coins ''(or 120 if you have the activated Ring of charos)''
Bowl of water ''(an empty bowl can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
3 buckets of milk ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
2 eggs ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
Any dye '''except''' red, yellow, or orange
Spice or gnome spice ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
Cake tin ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
Any cat except an overgrown cat ''(you'll be chase
Several bowls of stew ''(9 at most)''
Raw chompy ''(several recommended in case of burning)''
Ogre bow and several ogre arrows ''(10 is enough)''
2 pots of flour ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''
Pot of cornflour ''(or raw sweetcorn and an empty pot)''
Pot of cream ''(can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)''

title: Recruitment Drive
rewards: The Gaze of Saradomin - When you die, you will have the option of returning to Falador instead of Lumbridge. Talk to Sir Tiffy Cashien to change your spawn point at any time.
Appointment with the title of Initiate in the Order of Temple Knights.

other: The ability to defeat a level 110 Tyras guard (can be safespotted)

items: 5 coal in the bank (although at least 25 is recommended; you may bring the coal noted to save you a bank trip)
Bow and some arrows (or fire arrows
Limestone (or a pickaxe and ). Note that limestone bricks will '''not''' work.
Strip of cloth (made on a loom with 4 balls of wool; '''not''' a bolt of cloth - you can use the loom at the Iorwerth Camp or at the Falador farm)
Gloves, the list on Quicklime shows all gloves that work.

title: The Restless Ghost
rewards: Ghostspeak amulet (keep for several quests and content in the future)

title: The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour Dispute
Roving Elves

other: The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy unarmed, with Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|heavy restrictions

rewards: Crystal shield or bow with 500 charges

title: Rum Deal

other: The ability to kill a combat level 150 Evil spirit|monster (can be safespotted)

items: 47 prayer points for the ''Rum Deal#Evil spirits

rewards: The Holy wrench (while in your inventory, this grants more prayer points when drinking a prayer potion)

other: The ability to run past level 172 black demons and level 64 poison spiders

items: Swamp paste (made by mixing flour with swamp tar then cooking the mixture on a fire; can also be bought from a Trader crewmember for 75 coins, from Rasolo for 60 coins west of the Fishing Guild, or from the Khazard General Store for 42 coins at full stock)

quests: curse of the empty lord, for full ghostly robes
started desert treasure i, for the ring of visibility

items: Lockpick (Strange Old Lockpick does NOT work)

title: Shades of Mort'ton

other: Must be able to defeat 5 level-40 Loar Shades.
Must be able to survive an onslaught when rebuilding the Temple (Being surrounded by many players makes this much easier).
Access to Mort'ton

items: 5000+ coins (bring plenty of money just in case)
An axe for cutting pyre logs

Prior to building the temple, you need a hammer (1 coin at the general store). However, a regular hammer is insufficient to build the temple without a large group. An additional 13,000 coins (or }} on the Grand Exchange) allows you to buy a Flamtaer hammer from Razmire, which is necessary to complete this part of the quest without a group.

rewards: Bonus: If you take the Diary of Herbi Flax to the Apothecary in Varrock, you'll get an extra 335 Herblore (can only be done once).

title: Shadow of the Storm

other: The ability to defeat a level 100 demon

items: Any black outfit (minimum of 3 pieces, see Shadow_of_the_Storm#Starting_Out
Black dye (from grinding a black mushroom using a pestle and mortar alongside a vial)
Means to enter the desert (such as the Shantay pass (item)

rewards: 10,000 in any combat skill other than Prayer.
the Darklight sword - it has a special attack and is even more powerful against demons. It costs slightly more to replace.
Six cut gems: two sapphires, two rubies and two emeralds, if you use a hammer and chisel on the demon's throne and had not yet removed them during The Golem.

title: Sheep Shearer
rewards: 150 Crafting (An additional 50 if you make the balls of wool on a spinning wheel instead of buying it yourself)

title: Shield of Arrav
rewards: Additional rewards, which members can claim, when talking with Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum

title: Shilo Village

other: Must be able to defend from many Undead ones (level 61-73) and able to defeat three monsters that are about level 90.

items: A lit torch or candle (lanterns or a Firemaking cape don't work) (a black candle or a bruma torch will work, but '''you will not get this item back''')
Bronze wire (can be made from scratch using the General Store and Anvil north of Tai Bwo Wannai)

rewards: After completing the quest, you can sell every item you obtained during the quest to Yanni Salika in Shilo Village for a total of — 100 each for the stone-plaque, tattered scroll, crumpled scroll, Bervirius notes, and the bone key; 500 for the locating crystal; and 1000 for the beads of the dead.

title: Sins of the Father

items: Runes for Lvl-3 Enchant (1 cosmic rune, 5 fire runes) or an enchant ruby or topaz tablet

rewards: A tome of , granting 15,000 to any skill. (level 60 or higher). This reward can be utilised six times and may be used for the same skill.
Boat travel between Burgh de Rott, Slepe and the Icyene Graveyard
Promotion to the rank of Lieutenant within The Myreque and its associated title

items: Hammer or Imcando hammer (Other types of hammers will not work)

title: The Slug Menace

other: The ability to defeat a level 62 enemy with Melee.
You must have the Commorb in your inventory to start the quest.

items: Commorb (can get another by speaking to Sir Tiffy)
:'''OR''' Travelling through the Abyss or using a Runecraft cape
:'''OR''' Access to Guardians of the Rift

rewards: Promotion to Proselyte among the Temple Knights. This means you can buy and wear Proselyte armour with a greater Prayer bonus than Initiate. You can buy each piece individually, or buy the armour pack which, when opened, gives you the plate, helm, and legs/tassets all at once. The pack costs 25,000 coins
Buying the upgraded armour in separate pieces costs more: the helm costs 8,000 coins, the platelegs and plateskirt cost 10,000 coins, and the platebody costs 12,000 coins for a total of 30,000 coins
Required for the hard Falador Diary

items: Mourner gear including gas mask (plague jacket and plague trousers
Flowers from mithril seeds or adamant seeds, or an irit leaf
Wine of zamorak OR Zamorak brew
Seed dibber (or partial completion of the Farming portion of the Barbarian Training miniquest)
kills: Knight of Ardougne (Song of the Elves)

other: Ability to defeat three level 75 golems

items: Needle (Note: a Costume needle will not work)

other: The ability to defeat a combat level 170 monster, which is able to use Magic, Melee and can drain Prayer.

title: Tai Bwo Wannai Trio

items: Knife or bladed weapon, such as a Sword or a Spear
2 Logs to quickly make Poison karambwan at fishing site and to cook Pasty jogre bones later in the quest
Tinderbox (If you wish to avoid running back to the range in Brimhaven)
Karamjan rum or 30 coins to purchase (if obtaining the rum before starting, add the sliced banana or the rum will disappear when you leave the island)

rewards: 2,000 Coins (awarded by Timfraku immediately upon quest completion)
5,000 Cooking (claimed upon speaking to Tinsay after quest completion)
5,000 Fishing (claimed upon speaking to Tiadeche after quest completion)
2,500 Attack , 2,500 Strength , and a karambwan-poisoned rune spear (claimed upon speaking to Tamayu after quest completion)

title: A Tail of Two Cats

items: Cat or kitten (Hellcats work. Be sure to bring fish for your kitten if you're using one.)
Chocolate cake (made with cake and chocolate bar or chocolate dust with 50 )
Seed dibber (or partial completion of the Farming portion of Barbarian Training)

rewards: A Doctor's hat or Nurse hat (you can switch by destroying your hat and requesting a new one from the Apothecary)

items: Runes for 2-3 casts of any magic combat spell

title: A Taste of Hope

items: 1,000 coins (More if taking Andras' boat from the Ectofuntus, 10,000 each trip)
3 air runes, 1 cosmic rune, and having your magic set to the standard spells

rewards: Ivandis flail - A weapon that can damage the vyrewatch
Drakan's medallion - An amulet that gives the player unlimited teleports to the Theatre of Blood
Tome of , granting 2,500 to any three skills of the player's choosing (level 35 or over). Can be the same skill.

items: Lit sapphire lantern (use a cut sapphire on a bullseye lantern or on a bullseye lantern (unf)), make sure to use a tinderbox on it as Juna is busy Swamp tar to fill an empty sapphire lantern using the chemist in Rimmington or the lamp still in Dorgesh-Kaan
Rope (if you have not yet entered the Lumbridge Swamp Caves)

title: Temple of Ikov

other: The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy with Ranged

rewards: Armadyl pendant (if you sided with Lucien, you must kill Guardians of Armadyl to obtain it)
Optional; Shiny key, for a shortcut between the Temple of Ikov and McGrubor's Wood

title: Temple of the Eye
rewards: An additional 4,210 Runecraft is gained during the quest, for a total of 9,210
A medium pouch (if not already acquired)

items: Mith grapple (Hallowed grapple will not work)
Any non-silver ring such as a gold ring that you're willing to lose ''(not Onyx ring

title: The Tourist Trap

other: The ability to defeat a level 47 enemy

items: 1 Bronze bar (recommended to bring at least 2 additional bars, 24-96% chance to succeed based on Smithing level)
10 feathers (recommended to bring 30-50 feathers, 24-99% chance to succeed based on Fletching level)
Means to enter the desert. (Such as the Shantay pass (item)

rewards: 4,650 in your choice of two skills (you may pick same skill twice): Agility, Fletching, Smithing, or Thieving.

items: Beer (must be a regular beer - other beers do not work.)

other: The ability to defeat a level 112 Khazard warlord

title: Troll Romance

other: The ability to defeat a level 113 Arrg|troll

items: Climbing boots (not needed if using Trollheim Teleport)
Wax (can be made ahead of time) A bucket of wax (use insect repellent on a beehive followed by a bucket) A cake tin Swamp tar

rewards: 1 uncut diamond, 2 uncut rubies, and 4 uncut emeralds
A sled (required to complete a hard and two elite clue scroll steps)

title: Troll Stronghold

other: The ability to defeat a level 113 Troll General (can be safespotted)

items: Climbing boots or 12 coins to buy them

rewards: Law talisman (if you lose it, you can get another from Dunstan for 1,000 coins)
Law talismans can be obtained via Guardians of the Rift

items: 1-5 arrows (only non-poisoned arrows with metal arrowtips will work. Craw's bow does not work. Crossbows and bolts will not work. Broad arrows, Ogre arrows, and Ice arrows will also not work.)
Hammer (can be bought from the general store just north of the Blue Moon Inn for 1 coin)
Stake (obtained from Dr Harlow after giving him a beer)

other: The ability to defeat a level 32 Black Knight (Wanted!)|Black Knight.

items: 10,000 coins, or: Law rune Enchanted gem (bought from a Slayer Master) Molten glass
20 un-noted Rune essence or pure essence (you'll get them back) File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png The player must deliver all 20 rune essence at once
Light source ('''Note:''' Candles, torches and oil lamps can cause swamp gas explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

title: Watchtower

other: The ability to defeat a level 68 Ogre and run past level 111 Blue dragons

rewards: Designation by the Ogres of Gu'Tanoth as a "Friend of the Ogres"

other: The ability to withstand and evade attacks from level 86 Fire Giants and level 84 Moss Guardian without any equipment.

title: What Lies Below

items: Access to the Chaos Altar (Chaos talisman or Chaos tiara

rewards: 5 Battlestaves in stock of Zaff's Superior Staffs! store (after defeating King Roald - the quest doesn't need to be completed)

title: While Guthix Sleeps

items: Seed dibber (only if Barbarian Farming Training has not been completed)
1 log of any type except redwood (you can obtain one using a bronze axe next to the Hunting Expert)

rewards: 100 death runes, 100 fire runes, 100 coal, and 100 magic logs can be looted from Movario's base
Elite black armour and Dark Squall robes

other: The ability to defeat 4 monsters from level 19 to 53 without a break.

items: Cheese (You may wish to bring several in case you mess up. One source is in Draynor Village - Aggie's house)

title: X Marks the Spot

items: Spade (the Eastfloor spade does not work)

rewards: A beginner scroll box (only if the player does not have one already in their possession; can be claimed later if players had one in their possession already)
+1 cap on all tiers of clue scrolls

other: You must be able to defeat a level 111 enemy.
